column4: Ubuntu, agai, so quiet, I kinda like that... Okay, here my question: Is there a configuration interface to nautilus so I can add an item to the menu which runs a proram and hands it the current directory?
In my case I want an "open terminal" which opens a terminal in the specific dir.
Why so silent?
Any one here?
I know about you theadmin :P
what does a right click in nautilus produce ?
a right click produces a contex menu?
no "open terminal here"?
erm, no... :P
I find xpdf satisfactory
I don't like xpdf very much -it's functional but it's quite cumbersome and unhandy if it comes to doing things like zooming in and so forth
there's a comprimise between light and functionality...
I think xpdf doesnt make a compromise. its *just* light
do you know whether xpdf can be configured to open documents in continous view by default?
nope - I just use it basically - don't read mant pdfs
i just found out that yes it can be configured neatly - nice!
great! :]
use xrandr now instead of xinerama
it s 2010
what?
use xrandr now instead of xinerama
